intro: Dirichletia rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' dirichletia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
